image.altText: A man stands with shark mitigation equipment, an airhorn and a first aid kit.

props.synopsis: Ocean users in South Australia's far west are implementing their own community safety measures such as cardboard signs and air horns, and say recently announced government funding doesn't go far enough.

title.children: Community calls for more shark mitigation funding after fatal SA attacks

image.altText: Paramedic wheels a trolley into an ambulance outside a health care facility.

props.synopsis: Health services warn of the dangers of heat-related illness on the vulnerable amid soaring temperatures across south-east Australia.

title.children: High-risk hot spell settles in for parts of Australia, sparking warnings

image.altText: A man stands with his hands on his hips in front of piles of waste materials.

props.synopsis: Discarded batteries, ancient rubber tyres and drums of oil are the kinds of waste sitting on Australia's remote cattle stations that could have a brand new life if a researcher's plan comes to fruition.

title.children: The challenges of dealing with waste on remote cattle stations

image.altText: A house with red roof and red and cream brick with hard rubbish out the front

props.synopsis: Three youths accused of attempting to murder a man in Adelaide's north allegedly discussed their plans to make sure the target was dead in a group chat labelled "hit squad", a court has heard.

title.children: 'Hit squad': Six males face court over alleged botched murder attempt

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas and men from Santos stand on scaffolding at the Moomba CCS

props.synopsis: Santos says it's captured and stored 340,000 tonnes of CO2 and is on track to significantly expand operations â€” but an energy expert says in the scheme of Australia's 500 million tonnes of yearly emissions, it's more "PR exercise" than climate change solution.

title.children: As Santos celebrates carbon capture, expert says it's 'hardly a drop'

image.altText: Diesel submarine at a ship yard.

props.synopsis: A former senator says the documents are a sign the government is exploring the idea of dismantling nuclear submarines at shipyards in Adelaide's north-west, but the SA minister who attended the meeting says it was not the "focus" of the discussions.

title.children: Minister rejects claim talk about nuclear waste during UK trip signals plans for SA

image.altText: A man in handcuffs is escorted through a doorway by two policemen, with one holding him by the arm

props.synopsis: A Victorian man has been sentenced for his involvement in a nightclub stabbing in Adelaide's CBD that left two people injured.Â

title.children: Victorian man sentenced for 'chaotic' Adelaide nightclub stabbing

image.altText: Man standing in gardens

props.synopsis: A District Court Judge has asked for more evidence as to how much a by-election would cost before deciding whether to postpone Mount Gambier MP Troy Bell's sentencing on theft and dishonest dealing with documents offences.Â

title.children: By-election cost raised in Mount Gambier MP Troy Bellâ€™s fraud case

image.altText: An overhead shot of the Whyalla circular jetty

props.synopsis: The state and federal governments announced they will dedicate a combined $30 million to the Whyalla airport, in addition to $3.14 million from the federal government to kick start the long-awaited foreshore development.

title.children: Major cash injection for Whyalla foreshore development and airport

image.altText: A silhoutte of working dogs on a quad bike.

props.synopsis: "Baking heat" is set to spread into Australia's south-east this weekend, while north Queensland can expect intense rainfall.

title.children: Severe heatwave and flooding predicted for Australia this weekend

image.altText: A large blue sign which says police in front of a large stone walkway.

props.synopsis: The South Australian Liberal Party is highlighting an increase in thefts and break-ins in the regional city ahead of a possible by-election to replace an MP found guilty of stealing.

title.children: Opposition hits out at surge in break-ins and theft in Mount Gambier

image.altText: A massage parlour with pictures of massages in a shopfront

props.synopsis: A South Australian magistrate has accepted that two women caught running a brothel did not understand the practice was illegal in Mount Gambier, which lies close to the Victorian border.

title.children: SA sex workers escape conviction because of confusion over law

image.altText: Police car with officer and leafy street with houses in background.

props.synopsis: Police have responded to reports of a shooting incident in Adelaide's north-east.

title.children: Man taken to hospital after allegedly being shot in leg

image.altText: The exterior of a building with corrugated metal sheets and a bright red logo, reading APY Art Centre Collective

props.synopsis: The final investigation into allegations of interference in First Nations artwork has concluded, with the Indigenous corporation regulator saying no further action will be taken.

title.children: Investigation into 'white hands on black art' allegations concludes

image.altText: A koala looks down from the fork of a gum tree

props.synopsis: A sanctuary for up to 1,000 koalas and other wildlife is to be established on Kangaroo Island with the hope it will bring tourism and education opportunities while protecting the valuable population of marsupials.Â

title.children: New koala sanctuary plan for Kangaroo Island

image.altText: A teenage girl in figure-skating in a costume.

props.synopsis: Teenager figure skaters, world champions, and a pilot planning his wedding were among the 67 people killed when a passenger plane and an army helicopter collided.Â

title.children: What we know about the victims of the Washington plane crash

image.altText: Adam Reilly - man with white shirt and Indigenous artwork tie looks ahead

props.synopsis: Adam Reilly has told a parliamentary inquiry it was not his decision to leave the Department for Child Protection and has called for changes to the system.Â

title.children: 'Hurtful rumours': Former SA child protection chief explains departure

image.altText: A metal sign on a building saying YOUTH COURT

props.synopsis: A teenage girl who had items of extremist material on her phone and school-issued laptop is just a "young, naive, Muslim girl with autism", a court has heard.

title.children: Muslim girl 'with autism' pleads guilty to possessing extremist material

image.altText: Dozens of bricks of drugs wrapped and laid out on a blue tarp

props.synopsis: Two young Victorian men who were involved in the attempted importation of more than 100 kilograms of cocaine into South Australia have been sentenced to three years in jail with a non-parole period of 18 months.

title.children: Pair labelled 'muppets' jailed over attempted 'astronomical' cocaine import

image.altText: Steve Alderson photo

props.synopsis: Golfer Steven Alderson made international headlines when he became the first winner with autism on the Golf for the Disabled Tour. He hopes to use his success to inspire others living with autism to chase their dreams.

title.children: Bullied golf champion Steve Alderson hopes to become a beacon for others living with autism

image.altText: A person with long dark hair works on a computer with software code on two screens.

props.synopsis: With job availability in sectors such as healthcare and tech predicted to rise over the next 15 years, there is concern that some students are receiving outdated career guidance.

title.children: Fears Australia's kids aren't ready for jobs like automation engineer

image.altText: A Ukrainian serviceman patrols a street next to buildings damaged by fighting

props.synopsis: Ukraine believes North Korean soldiers fighting alongside Russia's army on the Kursk front line have been "withdrawn" after suffering heavy losses.

title.children: Ukraine says North Korean troops taken off Russian frontline

image.altText: Liu Dong holds up a small circular food item as she stands in front of a Japanese 7-Eleven, with ads for food around the door.

props.synopsis: Chinese citizens are continuing to migrate to Japan in increasing numbers, hoping to build better lives for family away from the censorship and repressive rule of Xi Jinping.

title.children: As Beijing embraces 'communal wealth', some Chinese people flee to Japan

image.altText: YanisVaroufakisQA_2024

props.synopsis: Analysts say TikTok's "soap opera" saga in the United States is highlighting the "Hunger Games" for social media dominance, with prominent author and economist Yanis Varoufakis calling for measures to take back control for users.

title.children: Economist wants to deal a 'major blow' to social media platforms

image.altText: close up of old man looking sad, he is sat in his home in germany

props.synopsis: A 99-year-old Holocaust survivor has said he would return his federal order of merit award in protest over parliament passing a motion with support from the far-right Alternative for Germany party (AfD).

title.children: Holocaust survivor to return German award over far-right role in parliamentary vote

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A flooded north Queensland road.

props.synopsis: Townsville's major dam is overfull, and those in low-lying residents are being instructed to be ready to evacuate their homes if the waters continue to rise as heavy falls continue.

title.children: 'Almost worse than a cyclone': Authorities knocking on 4,000 doors with flood warning

image.altText: A portrait of an Indigenous man who is about to perform in a dancing troupe.

props.synopsis: You might have seen this viral TikTok trend on your social media account. This is the story of the man behind it and why it's being labelled "disgusting".

title.children: Warning for TikTok users as 'disgusting' trend goes viral

image.altText: A boy sits and leans on a crutch with a mother's hands resting on his shoulders.

props.synopsis: Jungle medics and ethnic medical groups have become a lifeline for displaced people in Myanmar as the country becomes the world's deadliest for landmines.

title.children: 'My legs were gone': Hidden danger spreads amid Myanmar war

image.altText: close up of a man holding a leafy green branch

props.synopsis: Hamas has named the next three Israeli hostages to be released on Saturday in Gaza, in exchange for 90 Palestinian prisoners.

title.children: Hamas names another three Israeli hostages to be freed in Gaza

image.altText: Nathan Lyon, Dhananjaya de Silva and Mitchell Starc.

props.synopsis: Mitchell Starc shows his difference as rain and Dinesh Chandimal save the Sri Lankan captain's blushes. Here are the quick hits from day three in Galle.

title.children: Five quick hits: Starc's class apparent as rain spares skipper's shame

image.altText: Annabel Sutherland holds up her bat and helmet

props.synopsis: Australia continues its dominance over England, whose hapless fielding efforts saw them drop seven catches on day two of the Ashes Test at the MCG.

title.children: Sutherland's brilliance sets up dominant Ashes performance as England's fielding woes intensify

image.altText: A man with well manicured grey hair poses for a portrait.

props.synopsis: In an interview with Bruce McAvaney for ABC Sport Daily, IOC president candidate Sebastian Coe opens up about the burning topics impacting the future of the Olympics.

title.children: Coe opens up about Trump, gender, and the Brisbane Games

image.altText: Alex de Minaur plays a backhand return in a Davis Cup tie.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur and Aleksandar Vukic win their opening singles rubbers in Australia's Davis Cup first-round qualifying tie against Sweden in Stockholm.

title.children: De Minaur helps give Aussies Davis Cup lead against Sweden

image.altText: A man leans over to open a glass cabinet containing a rock statue.

props.synopsis: The statue was found on the outskirts of Gympie in 1966 as a farmer ploughed his field and historians have been trying to work out the story of its past ever since.Â

title.children: Mysterious history of rock 'ape' statue baffles visitors 60 years on
